_header: I have been a forester / Long and many a day
Note:
Cf. 2175; and for a companion song see 6503. See Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 518.
_description: A ‘jolly forester’ song: the old lover — six 5-line stanzas

BLAdd31922.First Lines: I haue bene a fosterlong & many a dayfoster wyl I be no moreno lenger shote I may…
BLAdd31922.Last Lines: …And pray I wyll for them þat mayfor may nowght but loke
BLAdd31922.Note: Words and notation for three voices on f. 65v, words without notation on f. 66.
